comments:
Driver : Ecloipse 3.1 I20050509-2010
JVM : IBM 1.4.2 SR1a
Platform : WindowsXP Japanese sp2

1. Open the Welcome menu
2. click Icon for "Samples"
3. click Icon for "SWT - Workbench views and standalone applications" 
or "Workbench - Java editor"
4. accept default project names, click Finish at Eclipse Samples wizard

Result
An error dialog "Reporting encoding changes" pop up three times. Following is 
the error stack of .log

Maz, has anyone investigated this?  Any plans for 3.1?

This seems to be reporting more code in Core than intro, cc'ing core.

Ive just started investigating this... not sure of it will make it into M7.
we might have broken samples for M7.

These stack traces are from a background job provided by Core. I don't think
there is anything for Intro here. Mazen, feel free to move to
Platform/Resources, otherwise I will open a separate PR for that.

false scare for me ! :) 
Rafael, thanks.

We didn't rebuild the samples in a long time, so it is possible that they need 
to be touched up.

Dejan... sample download works. I tried it with latest I build while 
investigating this. 
We need to refresh the samples thenselves from dec.org, but code works. This 
is unrelated to this defect.  

Masayuki,
is this bug reproducable consistantly?

Today I've refreshed installation and could not reproduce. Yesterday I was 
testing for several encodings for CVS server support. I guess that introduced 
some trouble. I tried to do the same CVS scenarios today but not reproducible 
for this PR. Please close this PR. Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback.

I will keep the PR open because it is an actual thread safety issue that needs
to be addressed. I just wanted to understand how severe the problem was. I would
be surprised if it happened often, since this was never reported before.

Mazen, does Intro install the example plug-ins in the running Eclipse? Or just
creates projects for them?

we download and install a the samples feature and the plugins. so features and 
plugins directories of your running eclipse are affected.
Original summary: "DBCS3.1: internal error at loading samples"
*** Bug 98034 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is happening not so rarely. Should try fixing for RC2. DJ, do you approve?
Let's see a patch to see how complicated the fix would be.

Created an attachment (id=24942)
patch for org.eclipse.core.runtime

Proposed fix. The list of file associations is considered immutable. All
changes happen atomically, to avoid having to synchronize when doing
traversals.
